title: Apple Pay: How to Send Money Directly from Your Digital Wallet

steps.title: Both you and the recipient need an Apple device.
steps.content: Both you and the recipient need an Apple device. Your Apple devices must be on the latest version of iOS. You cannot send money via Apple Pay to someone without an Apple device.

steps.title: You must be signed into iCloud and iMessage with the same Apple ID.
steps.content: You must be signed into iCloud and iMessage with the same Apple ID. You also must use two-factor authentication (2FA) with your Apple ID.

steps.title: An Apple Cash balance or a debit card in your Apple Wallet.
steps.content: An Apple Cash balance or a debit card in your Apple Wallet. You can't send money from a credit card.

steps.title: Start or open a Messages conversation with the intended recipient.
steps.content: Start or open a Messages conversation with the intended recipient. You can use a pre-existing Messages conversation if you have one started, or you can start a new conversation by tapping the new conversation button in the upper right-hand corner. [1] X Research source Note that you must be sending money to someone in the U.S. who also has an Apple device on the latest version of iOS.

steps.title: Tap the Apple Cash button.
steps.content: Tap the Apple Cash button. It's a black pill-shaped icon that has the Apple icon and the word "cash" in white writing. If you don't see the Apple Cash button, tap the blue button with an "A" next to your message box. This will open up the app drawer.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to send.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to send. You can use the plus and minus buttons to increase the amount, or you can tap Show Keypad to type in the amount manually.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. Your payment will appear in the message area.

steps.title: Tap the arrow next to your message text box to send the payment.
steps.content: Tap the arrow next to your message text box to send the payment. You will have to confirm the payment with Face ID, Touch ID, or your passcode. Note that by default, you will use your Apple Cash balance to pay, but you can change to a different debit card connected to your Apple Wallet by tapping the gray arrow next to your payment method. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Apple Wallet app.
steps.content: Open the Apple Wallet app. The icon looks like a wallet with multi-colored cards in it.

steps.title: Tap your Apple Cash card.
steps.content: Tap your Apple Cash card. Even if you don't have money on your Apple Cash card, you must initiate a funds transfer on the Apple Cash card section of your Apple Wallet app.

steps.title: Tap Send or Request.
steps.content: Tap Send or Request . Your phone will change screens to allow you to enter the contact you want to send money to.

steps.title: Enter the contact you're sending money to.
steps.content: Enter the contact you're sending money to. This contact must have an Apple device on the latest version of iOS to get the money you sent.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to send.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to send. Type the amount in with the keypad on the screen.

steps.title: Tap the arrow next to your message text box to send the payment.
steps.content: Tap the arrow next to your message text box to send the payment. You will have to confirm the payment with Face ID, Touch ID, or your passcode. Note that by default, you will use your Apple Cash balance to pay, but you can change to a different debit card connected to your Apple Wallet by tapping the gray arrow next to your payment method.
